Load Data Module¶

Load cleaned GradCafe JSONL data into PostgreSQL.

This module is designed to be executed as a script and will: - Ensure the applicants table exists. - Load rows from the master JSONL file and the new-rows JSONL file. - Deduplicate by URL before insert.

src.load_data.fdate(value)¶

Convert date strings to datetime.date.

Supports multiple formats used in the dataset.

Parameters:

value – Date string (e.g., “February 01, 2026”).

Returns:

datetime.date or None if parsing fails.

src.load_data.fdegree(value)¶

Normalize degree labels to numeric categories.

Parameters:

value – Degree label (e.g., “PhD”, “Masters”).

Returns:

2.0 for PhD/doctorate, 1.0 for masters, else None.

src.load_data.fnum(value)¶

Convert numeric-like values to float.

Parameters:

value – Any numeric-like value (str/int/float).

Returns:

Float if parsable, otherwise None.

src.load_data.ftext(value)¶

Normalize text values to strings without NULL bytes.

Parameters:

value – Input value.

Returns:

Cleaned string or None.

src.load_data.load_from_file(path)¶

Load JSONL rows from a file into the pending insert list.

Parameters:

path – JSONL file path.
